data.title: Honest and deliscious
data.text:
My friends and I are always on the look-out for Lebanese restaurants.  When we heard about Papa Marcos in Waukegan, we went there not knowing what to expect.
Here's what we found: The restaurant is like the old-fashioned diners of olden times: small, clean and simple.  It is run by a young couple, Marina and Michael.  Marina attended to our orders with a big smile and a cheerful  spirit. Two of us ordered lamb shawarma and one ordered chicken shawerma.  Big plates with  the grills came on top of a bed of saffron rice, and three bottles of condiments yogurt, tahini and gyro sauce.  I put tahini on one side of my plate and yogurt on the other. The result was very satisfactory.  We enjoyed a brief conversation with Marina and we we were rewarded with her intelligence and a small plate of baklava (on the house). Then Michael left his post in the kitchen and came over for a short visit.  We found him knowledgeable and charming.
Anyone who wants a low-cost, high quality lunch is encouraged to check our Papa Marcos.  The only thing I wanted but couldn't have was a beer, but the place is not licensed for alcoholic beverages.
The value for price index is very favorable for Papa Marcos.

data.title: A real local treasure
data.text: What a gem this is!  We've tried all the wraps and, while the beef Kifta is our favorite, all feature great grilled veggies and perfectly grilled meat.  The service is attentive and very friendly.  While small, the decor is nice and this is one of the cleanest places I've ever seen.  Great hummus, solid falafel and I've paid twice as much for baklava that was half as good.  Prices are very reasonable, not a single bad thing to say here.

data.title: Hidden Gem
data.text: In an area that is a food desert, this place is a 10. The selection of food, price, and cleanliness is a frequented place for lunch professionals. It becomes so busy, parking can be tricky at times but its worth it. I suggest the lunch special #1... filling and leaves you craving more.

data.title: Attentive Service, Excellent Food
data.text: Worth finding your way to Papa Marcos.  Don't miss the chicken soup starter or the Veggie Combo tray.

data.title: First visit....
data.text: 7 friends were going to the Genessee theatre for a concert and stopped in to dinner beforehand. What a find!  The people who run it, Marco and Marlene are extremely friendly, helpful and accommodating. It's a really eclectic little place, decorated in a style I've never seen before but cute and comfortable nonetheless. Nice menu with all kinds of mid-eastern and Mediterranean food. I'm not as familiar with this genre as my friends and they all raved about their dishes. And, it was very reasonable, I think under $12 a piece for each of us. Only a few blocks from the theatre, quick service, makes it the perfect place before a show. Would go back for sure.

data.title: Great food and terrific service
data.text: This was a great spot for lunch and the menu had something for all members of my family. The kibbee was the favorite and the copious amounts of Greek yogurt sauce made it even better.  Highly recommend.

data.title: Great prices, great food.
data.text:
Love going here for pizza for one.  Also their homemade soups.  Very good.  
They also have a variety of ice creams.  It's very busy during the summer months since it's right across the street from Six Flags; but it's smaller, cozy and family owned.

data.title: Papa Marco goes the distance
data.text: very good food - made by an unbelievably friendly  service from the husband/wife/staff.  The place not only serves middle eastern type foods, but has the usual hot dogs/ burger/ beefs/fries.  But i've only ever ate the middle eastern foods - which are spectacular.

data.title: Kegans first time at Marcos.
data.text: My girl and i come here everytime shes visiting. My son is here for the first time. And being 4 hes getting spoiled.

data.title: Fresh and Tasty!
data.text:
This place has been open a few years now and there quality is at the top! Many items are made fresh several times a day and when they get a run on an item and don't have time to make more...oh well!
Great Lunch deals!

data.title: Great Mediterranean Food
data.text: There aren't any other restaurants with this type of food so this is totally a great addition to Waukegan near it's down town area.  Great service, great food, a definite must try.

data.title: Lunch at an outstanding Lebanese Grill
data.text: We had lunch at this diner yesterday.   It is unimpressive from the outside--even discouraging.  It looks almost like a small grocery at a service station.  We had invited friends from out of town to meet us there so I went in to check it out before they arrived.  It was so tastefully decorated that I immediately decided we had suggested the right place.  There is a nice inside picture on their facebook page.   As usual for a Lebanese restaurant the meal was tasty and substantial.  The service was excellent and friendly.  The owner brought some baklava to our table as we concluded.  Nice touch!  We appreciated that the noise level was low so were able to converse easily.  We noted that it was crowded with locals during the lunch hour. We recommend it highly if you are in the Waukegan area.

data.title: Amazing
data.text:
The best restaurant in the area ✅ever 💯
. Clean . The people there are great . Helping. It's really good food .
You won't be disappointed promise 💯

data.title: Wow!
data.text: This was my first visit.  I was not sure what to order.  The cashier pointed out the lunch specials.  These are reasonably priced and offer 5-6 options.   Food was fresh, hot and tasty.  It was really more than one person could handle so I took the rest home :)  Nice find in Waukegan.

data.title: First Rate!
data.text: The service is unbelievably good!  They bend over backwards to make you welcome and take care of you.  The food is great on top of all of this.  We'll be back.

data.title: Great Mediterranean food
data.text: All the food choices are great and extremely reasonably priced  The owners and staff are very friendly.  For a real treat, tell Marlene you want a falafel sandwich done "David's way."

data.title: Excellent and authentic food
data.text: The atmosphere at Papa Marcos gives you the feeling that you have just entered a friend's home. The food is very authentic and tasty Lebanese cuisine.

data.title: Lunch and/or Dinner
data.text: I frequent this establishment weekly. I love the food, ambience, and customer service. The portion size is more than generous and I usually have leftovers.

data.title: Service Owner Price
data.text:
While the food here is great the service, owner and prices are even better!

Unbelievable service: We are warmly greeted every time we enter here.  Hopefully there isn't wait and we get seated right away.  The food delivered to our table quickly, hot and fresh.  There are often little extras provided free of charge - a sample of grape leaves or a plate of baklava.

Owner: Love Michel.  He served in the US military for many years and is now doing this.  Quite successfully.  From Lebanon he fought in the Christian militia in the seventies.  He is fluent in French and Arabic and work as a translator for the US.  Those are the same two languages that our daughter is fluent in so we were happy to introduce her to Michel recently.

Prices: You can't beat the value here.  Big plates of hummus and baba ghanoush.  Love the plates of Shawarma (you can get a combo of meat) served over rice.  I can never get enough of the tahini sauce and hot sauce.  We also love the vegetarian platter.

data.title: Overall great place to eat
data.text: We were visiting relatives and decided to stop here based on reviews and menu. Glad we did! It was not busy when we were there and there were 3-1/2 of us (3 adults and a 3-1/2 month old baby). The food was all really good and quite reasonably priced. The service was outstanding. The gentleman there (the owner maybe?) was very helpful and friendly. He was also pleasantly interactive with the baby. We also ordered a meal to go at the end and he threw in an extra dessert. Would definitely go back when in the area.
